reviewText: A slick and well-paid defense attorney takes the case of a wealthy man who is accused of assaulting a prostitute. His guilt or innocence is seriously in question early on, and the case brings into doubt the guilt of one of his previous clients who is currently imprisoned. The lead character, Mickey Haller is not very likable, but the storyline is quite engrossing. There is no dead time in the film, with the entire movie focusing on the case at hand, keeping the viewer intrigued. The resolution of the case is not seriously in question, but the journey in getting there is worth the trip.

which is a good thing. The actors hit their spots and this feels great. All characters are less than perfect. Some are evil. Real lawyers can say it feels real. Can't ask for more from a movie like this. Good actors in even the small parts, which is a testament to their belief in the movie. Liked it a lot.

"The Lincoln Lawyer" is excellent! This is how the story goes: Mickey Haller is a Los Angeles criminal defense attorney who operates out of the back of his Lincoln sedan. Haller has spent most of his career defending garden-variety criminals, until he lands the case of his career: defending Louis Roulet, a Beverly Hills playboy accused of rape and attempted murder. But the seemingly straightforward case suddenly develops into a deadly game of survival for Haller.

The cast led by Matthew McConaughey (excellent as Mickey Haller) is excellent. The directing by Brad Furman (who also directed "The Take" (2007) is excellent. The screenplay (based on Michael Connelly's novel) by John Romano (who also wrote the screenplay to "The Third Miracle" (1999), "Nights In Rodanthe" (2008) & the story to "Intolerable Cruelty" (2003) is excellent.

The music by Cliff Martinez (who also did the music to "Sex, Lies, And Videotape" (1989), "Pump Up The Volume" (1990), "Kafka" (1991), "The Limey" (1999), "Traffic" (2000), "Narc" (2002), "Solaris" (2002), "Wonderland" (2003), "Wicker Park" (2004), "Havoc" (2005), "First Snow" (2006) & the upcoming "Contagion" (2011) is excellent. The cinematography by Lukas Ettlin (who also did the cinematography to "The Take", "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning" (2006), "Never Back Down" (2008), "Fanboys" (2008), "The Killing Room" (2009), "Shrink" (2009), "Middle Men" (2010) & "Battle: Los Angeles" (2011) is excellent. The film editing by Jeff McEvoy (who also did the film editing to "Wonderland", "Turistas" (2006), "Swing Vote" (2008) & the upcoming "Cat Run" (2011) is excellent. The casting by Deborah Aquila & Mary Tricia Wood (both of them, recently, did the casting to "Valentine's Day" (2010), "Killers" (2010), "The Expendables" (2010), "Red" (2010), "The Rite" (2011), "Red State" (2011), "I Am Number Four" (2011), the upcoming "Red Dawn" (2011), "One For The Money" (2011), "My Week With Marilyn" (2011), "Man On A Ledge" (2012), "Underworld 4: New Dawn" (2012), "Hansel And Gretel: Witch Hunters" (2012) & "Gone" (2012) is excellent. The production design by Charisse Cardenas (who also did the production design to "The Take", "The Killing Room" & the upcoming "Gone", she also did the set design to "The Postman" (1997), "Hard Rain" (1998), "Lethal Weapon 4" (1998), "End Of Days" (1999), "Big Momma's House" (2000), "The Kid" (2000), "Almost Famous" (2000), "The Glass House" (2001), "Bandits" (2001), "Tears Of The Sun" (2003), "The Alamo" (2004) & "Surrogates" (2009) is excellent. The set decoration by Nancy Nye (who also did the set decoration to "Less Than Zero" (1987), "The Craft" (1996), "Gattaca" (1997), "Supernova" (2000), "Matchstick Men" (2003), "Coach Carter" (2005), "Domino" (2005), "Fracture" (2007) & "How Do You Know" (2010) is excellent. The costume design by Erin Benach (who also did the costume design to "Half Nelson" (2006), "Sugar" (2008), "Blue Valentine" (2010), "Devil" (2010) & the upcoming "Drive" (2011) is excellent.

This is an excellent thriller that keeps you thinking and on the edge of your seat. This is an entertaining and well-crafted movie. Matthew McConaughey gives one of the best performances, if not, the best performance, of his career, thus far.

There's solid writing here and Mcconaughey really delivers the goods. It's also got a fantastic supporting cast. Although, Phillipe is a bit underwhelming in his role. The film's main offense is it's third act. It's tremendously convoluted and overstays its welcome. There are far too many plot turns packed into a meager 10-15 minute span. For instance, the biker gang thread seemed disposable, just more clutter. And a last minute reveal is not appropriately prepared for or ever really explained (w/r/t character motivation) -- worse, it's unnecessary. All in all, it's a pretty compelling yarn that's hampered by its break-neck pace and an overlong, ill-constructed third act.
"They" need to make the next book of the Lincoln Lawyer. I know Michael Connelly is busy with Bosch, which is kinda heavy, but he could do another Mickey Haller movie. It's lighter fare.

Revisiting this film based on the Michael Connelly bestseller of the same name was a treat.  While not a faithful retelling of the book the big screen version is entertaining in its own right.  L.A. attorney Michael J. (Mickey or Mick) Haller is a savvy defender of sleaze balls and bottom feeders.  He lost his drivers license in a DUI and works out of the back of a Lincoln Continental (hence the title) driven by his part time chauffer Earl.  Haller gets involved in the case of a wealthy young playboy accused of murdering a prostitute.  There are plenty of twists and turns along the way and the story holds your attention.

  Matthew McConaughey,plays Mick Haller with flair, his presentation is a bit slicker than Connellys depiction but it works well here.  Unfortunately, clocking in at just under two hours theres not a lot of time for character development.  Hallers investigator played by William H. Macy and one ex-wife and ADA played by Marissa Tomei are fairly fleshed out but everyone else is pretty one-dimensional.  For example Hallers other ex-wife Lorna is in the movie but her role is miniscule here and if you didn't read the screen credits you wouldnt know she appeared at all.  In the novels she has a much greater part running Micks admin side of things.

  All in all The Lincoln Lawyer is a good time that will keep you guessing even if you read the book.  It would have been a good franchise vehicle for McConaughey,or even turned into a TV series.

The Lincoln Lawyer stars Matthew McConaughey (Dallas Buyers Club) as Mick Haller, a smooth Los Angeles criminal defense attorney, who cruises the streets in his mobile office  a Lincoln Town Car. Hes adept at using his Southern accent and self-assured swagger to charm assorted members of the legal system.

Hallers ex-wife (Marisa Tomei) works in the DAs office, but he prefers to work in the lower levels of the court system. His bail bondsman friend (John Leguizamo) brings him his latest case: Louis Roulet (Ryan Phillippe), a rich Beverly Hills child of privilege accused of beating up a prostitute. The arrogant Roulet treats the charges against him lightly, and refuses to accept a plea deal, insisting on his innocence despite incriminating evidence.

McConaughey made this film after a series of lightweight romantic comedies, and it showcases an acting ability beyond merely smiling, making wisecracks, and doing at least one scene bare-chested. The character of Haller is complex, and the script takes some interesting and unanticipated turns.  The supporting cast of Phillippe, Leguizamo, Tomei, Brian Cranston, Michael Pena, and William H. Macy (as Hallers private investigator) are excellent, adding stature to this legal thriller. There are some convenient coincidences in the plot but, for the most part, the story builds suspense and keeps us involved.

Bonus materials on the R-rated 2-disc 4K Ultra HD/Blu-ray Combo Pack include the featurettes Making the Case: Creating The Lincoln Lawyer, At Home on the Road, and One On One with Matthew McConaughey and writer Michael Connelly; and deleted scenes. A digital HD copy is enclosed. Other editions available are single-disc Blu-ray and single-disc DVD.

Even though I read mysteries all the time, I had never read a Michael Connelly book.  That is until I learned that The Lincoln Lawyer was being made into a movie.  A few months before the film was released, I read the book.  Having watched the film, I've got to say, I am impressed with it.

Mick Haller (Matthew McConaughey) is a defense lawyer working in Los Angeles, California.  Since his cases are spread out all over the area, he works from his Lincoln town car.  His clients are as diverse as the drug grower for a bike gang and a prostitute addict.

But Mick thinks his ship has come in when he takes on the case of Louis Roulet (Ryan Phillippe).  Louis is accused of beating a woman with the intent of killing her.  Louis proclaims his innocence, and it really does look like it will be an easy win for Mick.  Just as his dreams of a big payday begin to fade, things begin to heat up and Mick realizes this case isn't going to be as simple as he thought it would be.  Can he clear Louis' name, or is Louis guilty?

As a reader, I often have a hard time with movies based on books I've read.  They leave too much out, or change things I loved.  I definitely noticed some changes here, but they were minor things.  In fact, in some cases I think it helped the flow of the story.  They certainly did a good job of taking a 400 page book, condensing it down to 2 hours, and leaving in all the twists and turns.

Of course, to do that, some things did have to be cut.  Most of the cutting involved character development.  The characters in the book were richly drawn, and they aren't nearly as real here.  Likewise, some of the twists seemed a little abrupt with little to no explanation to go along with them.  I think I actually understood the story a little better because I'd read the book.  A few things would have me scratching my head if I'd only seen the movie.  But maybe that's me being thick headed and it won't be an issue for anyone.  On the plus side, they did cut down on some parts of the book that I felt dragged.  This story is always movie forward.

When I first heard this movie was being made, I heard people complaining about the casting of Matthew McConaughey as Mick.  This is only one story with the character, and people naturally have an attachment to him.  Since I've only read the one book and it was recently, I didn't have nearly as big a problem with this casting choice.  And I thought Matthew did a great job.  He's charming, smooth, and oily at the beginning, but he delivers the weightier emotions as the story really gets going.  Likewise, Ryan Phillippe is outstanding as Louis.  Any time the scene focuses on the two of them, the dynamic between them is outstanding.  The rest of the cast delivers as well, but those two are really the stars of the film.

I wasn't at all surprised when I learned that this movie was rated R.  Between the language in the book and the sexual nature of the crime at the heart of the story, anything less would have robbed the story of so much.  Just be aware what you are getting into when you step into the theater.

Fans of The Lincoln Lawyer have nothing to worry about.  I don't know how we could have gotten a better film version of the book.  And if you are new to the story, you'll find an entertaining thrill ride that will made you want to search out more of Michael Connelly's books.

The Lincoln Lawyer

 Many movie mavens have long suspected that Matthew McConaughey might well have the capacity to be a great dramatic actor.  In The Lincoln Lawyer the suspicion becomes fact. We can no longer discount McConaughey as just a pretty face, just someone to fill in the male half of romantic comedies.  This movie is great fun, interesting to watch, very well written and performed by a truly outstanding cast with flawless acting.
 The first kudos must go to the writer, John Romano.  Romano also penned the successful and fascinating Intolerable Cruelty.  The Lincoln Lawyer has enough twists and turns for even the most jaded mystery junky.  McConaughey plays the lawyer.  His client might well be innocent of the murder for which he is charged.  The Lawyer is haunted by the possibility that he might not be able to save an innocent man, a threat that hangs like a shroud over his professional life.  Romanos script keeps the surprises coming and the intensity building until the very last frame.
 We begin to view the film with an introduction to the McConaughey character.  He is a streetwise young lawyer with the typical McConaughey swagger and confidence and a relentless, unprincipled ambition.  As the plot is reveled, we see him fold in on himself as the pressures of the case squeeze in on him until we find him pouring down desperate quaffs of Alka-Seltzer.
 Oscar winner Marisa Tomei plays his ex but still affectionate wife.  To see her is to be reminded exactly why she has been nominated for the Academy Award on three occasions.
 William H. Macy gets to play a gritty, long haired investigator who is the right hand man to the lawyer.  Other excellent efforts can be awarded to both Ryan Phillippe and especially to John Leguizamo, the latter as a truly slimy bail bondsman.
 This is absolutely the best lawyer film in several years and is arguably the best Matthew McConaughey role ever.  This outstanding film lasts almost exactly two hours.  It is rated R for adult situations, murder and language.  With a $40 million budget and worldwide receipts of only $58 million, the film is bringing in much less than it deserves or that will please the producers.  The Lincoln Lawyer is nearing the end of its theatrical release.  You should see this four saw blade film while you have the chance.

Legal/courtroom thrillers seem to be a rare breed these days, perhaps due to complete TV saturation thanks to Law and Order and the like. With no shoot-outs, car chases or whiz-bang special effects, the film has to rely, most refreshingly, on the quality of the acting, plot and the direction. McConaughey plays the central role of the coolly professional defence lawyer with understated aplomb and the plot is sufficiently twisty (though, unfortunately, by no means totally unpredictable) for the narrative to remain engaging. There is also a lovely, almost old-fashioned, stylishness to this film which perfectly matches the consistently managed pace. All-in-all a very accomplished and enjoyable film.

Mickey Haller, a defense lawyer who practices out of the back seat of his Lincoln, is wise-cracking, charming, and smart. He takes the case (on the tip from a bail bondsman) of a rich kid who's been accused of beating and raping a young woman. He claims he has been set up. Matthew McConaughey as Mickey Haller, Marisa Tomei as his ex-wife and a prosecutor, William Macy as his investigator, and an excellent supporting cast make this movie a joy to watch (I've watched it four times). Excellent cast, excellent tone, excellent script...wonderful.

Matthew McConaughey. What can you say about this actor? Hes been around a long time, but his films
thus far have been about surfer dudes (seriously, the 2008 film was called Surfer, Dude), adventurers (as
in the 2005 film Sahara or the 2008 blunder Fools Gold), or a seemingly endless string of garden variety
fluffy romance comedies (reallya ton of those, like 2006 Failure to Launch or 2003 How to Lose a Guy in
Ten Days). It was in fact 2003 since Ive seen him in something because everything that hes been in has
not been my taste. Whose taste do they appeal to? Im not sure, but I am certain that somebody reading
this will say, Who is this guy (meaning me) to bust on my Matthew? What a hunk he is (meaning that
guycertainly not me)!
Then there comes The Lincoln Lawyer. In this film, McConaughey plays a defense attorney who loves his
work of getting the scum of the earth out of sticky legal situations. He makes his office in the back of a
dated Lincoln Continental, where he has a driver escorting him around after a DUI incident a number of
months back. So I love the premise, which shows great promise. But Matthew McConaughey? Do you
mean you're really going to get me into a theater where a Matthew McConaughey film is playing?
As if the premise wasn't enough to lure me in, the film stars Marisa Tomei. Heck, I don't even have to
like a movie to enjoy Marisa in it. Look at last years Cyrus? What an odd, too odd to like, movie. But did
I like her in it? Well And Ive always like William H. Macy, whose characters are convincing and his
delivery although in the same vein flows differently every time. He cleans up well, and he gets grungy
well too.
The Lincoln Lawyer delivers. And Im not just saying that because I like legal thrillers (and lets not kid
ourselves, thats all this is), but this does not sacrifice story for stereotypeand McConaughey (here it
is, hes going to say it) pulls off his characters tormented and trapped nature beautifully. Wow! Have
things changed for McConaughey? Will I rush to see his next movie? I guess time will tell.

Despite the recent ascent of Matthew McConaughey in America's acting pantheon, my expectations for The Lincoln Lawyer were not correspondingly elevated. But The Lincoln Lawyer was very decent entertainment. This is not the remarkable McConaughey we have seen in recent films (perhaps starting with the fantastic Mud), but it is quite engaging and highly recommended. There is a fun story and it is snappily edited.

I had first read the book by Michael Connally and I wanted to see the movie.  I found the book quite good, but the movie did not measure up to the same level of suspense.

I saw this again last night and it holds up beautifully.  Connelly should be very pleased and ready to sign on for a series of Mickey Haller films.  This is smooth, effective filmmaking: a strong plot, exceptional actors, top production values and just enough sex and violence to earn the R without distracting us unnecessarily.

Matthew McConaughey plays Mickey Haller to a fare-thee-well.  He is defending a decadent sleazeball and, in return, pocketing a tidy fee.  At the same time his heart is breaking over the fact that he struck a plea deal for a former client who, he now knows, was innocent.  The man is rotting in San Quentin and will likely spend 15 years of his life there.  Suddenly it hits him: the sleazeball he is currently defending may well have perpetrated the murder for which his other, falsely-accused client, took the fall.  This guy likes to kill women and then watch others serve time for it.  He also likes to entrap his lawyer, who is bound by attorney-client privilege rules.  Mick has to get the sleazeball off but, simultaneously, he has to also see him convicted and his prior client freed.

How will he do that?  Thats the nub of the mystery.  In the process he will be supported by his ex-wife Maggie (Marisa Tomei), his investigator (William H. Macey) and the head of a biker gang (Trace Adkins).  This is delicious L.A. crime narrative.  If you haven't seen it yet, a significant treat awaits you.

This is the second time I've watched this movie--the first time being in the theater.  That is usually a sign for me that a movie is more than passably good.  This one has the unique concept of a criminal trial lawyer that doesn't really have an office, other than his Lincoln town car.  Most of his clients are guilty as sin and the one thing he is most worried about is having an innocent client.  The right thing to do in that case would be a complete acquittal--not something he usually tries to achieve.  This one has some crazy twists and turns, a decent amount of suspense and the acting is mostly really good.
Excellent plot and cast throughout.  Very quick moving plot w/ a lot of energy and quick thinking by attorneys, clients and courtroom drama.

This movie perfectly meets the requirements of the genre, and the only reason I give it four stars instead of five is that the genre itself -- slick, plot-driven, "sting" movie -- is a pretty easy thing to do and doesn't really stretch the actors all that much.  I enjoyed the novel on which this movie was based, and now, about 4 years later, I've gotten round to the movie.  It does justice to the tone, spirit and much of the detail of the movie.  The cast is absolutely up to the job -- McConaughy, Marisa Tomei, William H. Macy, Ryan Philippe, and, in a small role, Bryan Cranston -- all are fine, as are the less well-known supporters.  If I had to pick one out, I would say that Macy brings something -- maybe just his look -- that you remember in a quite small role that is nonetheless important to the plot.  Pacing, camera work, music -- all apt.  So if you like plots that have more twists than a corkscrew and haven't seen this one, it won't disappoint you.

The Lincoln Lawyer, 2011 film

A man gets out of a car and enters a secured place. Another man talks to him about a criminal case. He talks to a bailiff about a defendant; the trial is held over. Lawyer Michael Haller stops his car to talk about that case. Haller visits his next client; "it was a set-up". The man is accused of beating a woman, but gets out on bail. Haller knows how to handle the press! He names his price to the family lawyer. A young woman is fingerprinted and processed. Haller arrives to advise her and learns what happened. Her customer paid in drugs not money, then she was caught. Haller talks to the prosecutor and makes a deal: his client will walk if she gives up this wanted man. Louis Roul is out, Haller meets his mother. Roul insists he is innocent, and tells his story. Note the differences in the point of view! Investigator Frank will check out the client's story. \

Haller gets a ride home. Next morning Frank brings in a DVD about the event. Haller shows the DVD to the prosecutor. There is a discrepancy in the discovery file. [Prosecutors have to turn over their known facts to the defense counsel.] Haller tells his client to follow orders. A detective talks to Haller about the justice system. Later Haller meets a woman and they become very friendly. Haller studies the pictures of that woman. [Note the lack of bruises on her left side.] A prisoner insists he is innocent and won't take a deal. Haller visits a prisoner and hears his story. He reconsiders this case. Was a client really innocent? Haller has a dilemma. Can Frank find other cases like this one? Roul makes a surprise visit to tell Mich something. The next day Haller learns his investigator was shot and killed at home! [Note the black blood from a body over an hour old.] Mick is upset and sees a man who could be involved.

Later Mick talks to Maggie about "pure evil". Mick listens to his answering machine. Frank was killed by a Colt Woodsman (a .22 automatic). Did Mick have an unsecured pistol at home? The trial of Louis Roul goes on. The police search Mick's home. They have old evidence on that Woodsman, it was a gift from Mickey Cohen. Regina Campo testifies and is cross-examined. The next day Louis Roul testifies. "I am innocent!" There is a rebuttal witness, a man held in jail (a "snitch"). Why do people talk to him in jail? Can an old newspaper report affect the trial? There is a surprise ending! "Whose side are you on?" But there's more to come. Where is he going? There is a final confrontation. Mick knows people who can help him. There is another surprise at the end! Call 911. [It takes a good guy with a gun to stop a bad guy with a gun.] "Martinez is free." There is a repeat customer.

This story starts out as an example of the practice of criminal law, then develops into a very interesting story about a murder. There was a novel in the 1960s "The Seventh Juror" about a murder trial where the real murderer was an observer in the courtroom. Would he be found out in the end?

There is something so satisfying about seeing two really smart people in a battle of wits. It's one of my favorite plot devices. For me, another favorite is handsome men...and look at this cast:
  * Matthew McConaughey ("We Are Marshall") is a slick, successful, street-wise lawyer, but he actually believes in Justice. His office is a Lincoln town car.
  * Ryan Phillippe ("Breach") is his client, accused of rape and attempted murder. This baby-faced character presents quite a quandary: Is he or is he not guilty?
  * Josh Lucas ("Glory Road" - I've been a fan since "Sweet Home Alabama") is the prosecutor confronted by death of a thousand cuts. It's not as bad as it sounds.
  * Michael Par ("Hope Floats" and for you hard-core fans, "Eddie and the Cruisers") is a frustrated detective.
  * John Leguizamo ("Moulin Rouge!") is the fast-talking street guy who pulls our hero into the game.
  * William H. Macy ("Shameless") is our hero's right-hand man, quick, resourceful...and funny.
  * Laurence Mason (LOTS of TV) is his chauffeur; he has the best line: "You're nobody 'til somebody shoots you!"

The female roles are mostly window dressing except for Frances Fisher ("Jolene") who plays the accused fellow's mother; the script has plenty of laughs, with many upbeat characters and a twisty plot worth following. By the time we know what happened, we still can't see where we're going.

All in all, this is an exciting, satisfying, well-shot film with plenty of people to root for, very little profanity, no car chases and no blowie uppie stuff.

I grew up wanting to be a lawyer as a kid. I grew up watching perhaps the best show of the 1990s, easily the best show in the drama category of that decade-The Practice, followed by its spin-off Boston Legal, as an adult. But I didn't think I'd be as interested in this movie, probably because watching a lawyer on film is different from watching one on television. But I gave it a shot. I won't exhaust you with the details of the storyline or criticize Matthew Mcconaughey (which seems to be a popular thing to do), given that there are over a thousand reviews of this movie, but I will briefly say, this is a film about a lawyer whose client turns out to be something he initially suspected and they take turns outdoing one another, which has fatal consequences.

When I read the Lincoln Lawyer, I was impressed with the plot, the characters, and the fact that I had to work to figure out "who done it." I know that honing a book and its story down to 2 hours, more or less, is daunting, but this is one of the better attempts.  McConaughey makes a better than passible Mickey Haller and Ryan Phillippe is very well cast as his dubious client.  This is one to see.

I grew up in a small rural town.  Most of what I know about city crime and criminal behavior is from movies and books.  The Lincoln Lawyer himself, Matthew McConaughey, is the epitome of city smarts.  He can handle the scumbags, the tough bikers, and on to the rich sophisticates.  He pushes the legal envelop and with the help of his great chauffeur Earl, played perfectly by Laurence Mason he is able to ride the edge in style.  The bad boy Louis Roulet will make you mad as he tries to manipulate Mick Haller, the lawyer.  Though I wouldn't call the movie a thriller, it is a great mystery story and is as much fun as was the book.

I read the book a long time ago and enjoyed it as much or more than the movie.  Like all of Michael Connelly's stories this one kept you turning the pages and hating it when you got to the last one.  The movie will keep you glued the same way.

In retrospect, the plot elements are somewhat familiar, but with enough unexpected plot twists and so well-executed in this movie it was a complete joy to watch them roll out.  The acting is superb -- McConaughey gives his best performance ever, and the rest of the cast is excellent, down to the supporting roles of the prison cons. The linchpin to the plot is how the Lincoln lawyer can solve his dilemma of defending a client he knows is responsible for sending another of his clients to life in prison, and the suspense builds to the very end. This is a keeper, one to watch again and again.  Highly recommended!
Brilliant movie, I can watch Matthew McConnaughey eat mashed potatoes honestly, but this is a compelling and gripping movie. Highly recommended. Book is great too.

This is a story about the Lincoln lawyer (the automobile, not the 19th century president), Mickey Haller, defending a young, wealthy but evil man from an evil family against charges that he beat up a high-money party girl. As Haller and his investigative team dig deep they find their client might not be the lily white poor little rich boy they had been led to believe. The middle part of the story drags a bit but catches fire toward the end. The exciting legal protocols might just be the best Connelly has written. Even if you're an anti-lawyer person, Connelly does a masterful job of roping you in with Haller's enticing courtroom actions. The last half of this novel will keep you up long past your bedtime. Strongly recommend it.

Michael Connelly's 2005 novel, The Lincoln Lawyer, garnered critical and commercial success. The film adaptation stays loyal to the novel, and is very entertaining.

Matthew McConaughey portrays the main character Mickey Haller as a kind of lovable, bad boy. Haller is a lawyer who has made a career of representing criminals and outcasts. He runs his practice out of his old Lincoln, and drives around town looking for his next case. Early on in the film, we are introduced to his ex-wife, played by Marisa Tomei, with whom he has a young daughters. It is in these moments that we get to see the softer side of Haller.

The story really gets moving when Haller is called to represent Roulet, a high profile, Los Angeles playboy who is accused of murdering a prostitute. Despite a bad gut feeling, Haller knows that this case could be the high point of his career. With the help of his own investigator Frank Levin, played by a show-stealing William H. Macey, Haller soon finds a connection to a previous case that has haunted him for years.

Overall, the film is a great mix of action, intrigue and comedy. McConaughey's everyman persona really helps Haller to be relatable and an effective protagonist. Ryan Phillippe is surprisingly effective at staying in the grey area as Roulet. The real star of the movie is Macey, who's appearance is cut short way too soon. This movie effectively captures the essence of Connelly's novel while still adjusting to the new medium. While this adaptation is pretty black and white, it is still very entertaining.

McConaughey OWNS the character of Mickey Haller, which is a good and bad thing. Good, because this excellent book deserved this equally excellent movie and portrayal. Bad, because McConaughey's career has since reignited and it seems unlikely he will make a sequel. The #3 book in this series by Michael Connelly, The Reversal, is especially movie-worthy, just in case McConaughey wants to have some more fun, which he clearly did making this one!
This movie was very good with a great plot.  What made it even better was the twists and turns. I could not see the ending coming until the very moment the movie revealed its final plot twist.
This movie was the best we have seen in a long time. You know who did it but can anyone prove it! In the end he gets what he deserved. Really good movie
Great movie with great actors. Good story line. Great drama with some action. Matthew is always a good actor but he plays a tough guy here not a romantic character so it's a nice change for him.

This is a story of which we know the ending within the first half hour. But the acting is good, the script is decent, and it's pretty well shot, so I rate it a pretty good watch, though I'm a bit biased because I fancy the genre.
Excellent movie Mat plays the roll of a Linclon Town Car back seat lawyer great story line full of action this movie had me on the edge of my seat
Great DVD.  I love Michael.  Very sexy and a good story.  Hope that he will make another Lincoln Lawyer movie.

One of the best legal thrillers I have seen or read in a very long time. Matthew McConaughey was brilliant. Characters were well developed and realistic. The story had enough twists and turns to keep you on the edge of your seat. I highly recommend seeing this one!
I love this movie! Cool when someone starts out smarmy and turns into a cool guy! I love Matthew McC anyway. But this really a great story!

As a former legal assistant for many years, I met too many characters like this. He is arrogant and a shyster (as my Daddy used to say). Not interesting enough to bother watching. I would have hung in longer if the office-vehicle had been an old Lincoln Towncar used by an honest young attorney trying to establish himself. That could have been a good story!

Very clever premise.  The ending came as a surprise.
Acting was excellent by all the lead characters and I really liked Marisa Tomei

I really liked this movie ALOT!!

Matthew's character is unapologetically awesome.  The plot of the movie kept me very interested through out.  over all a very good film...enjoy!
It was a very good movie.  I would watch it again if necessary.  I would love to share with my hubby because he would like it too!
A year ago a friend told me this was the best movie they had ever seen.  Never got around to watching until now.  What a great moving. Loved the action and the results at the end.
I loved the interaction between the two main characters.  They are divorced but have a very amicable relationship as it pertains to their daughter.
I had skipped over this film several times because I didn't think I would really like it.  Was I wrong!!  This is a great movie.  I will enjoy watching it again.
Enjoyed this movie. The story was interesting, and it was acted well. Keeps you interested until the final scene. A good movie night flick.

Very good movie.  Ending could have been done better, but a good solid movie with McConaughey doing a very good job.  Excellent supporting cast.  Very familiar faces and surprised to see so many of them in one movie.  A good Saturday night - date night movie.

Matthew does a phenomally good job as a L.A. "Defense Lawyer" in this suspense thriller.  Just the right amount of both sleaze and pinache to work the court system as well as a client who tries to outwit him.  Ryan Phillipe is a believeable "Choir Boy" type character with a dark soul.  The movie is very reminiscent of the 1996 Richard Gere movie "Primal Fear" in many was, however this is the much updated version.  If you like movies with a definate "twist" to them then this one won't dissappoint!
Bit of a twist, nice story line and it keeps you engaged in the plot.  Nice ending, and i think most will enjoy.
I've seen this movie before and I enjoyed wastching it again. This is a fast paced and quick witted film.
This is a good movie, especially if you are a fan of Matthew McConaughey.  A good character for him.  I liked it.
Action packed movie with a great plot.  Makes you think what you would have done if you were in the same place.
This was a great movie with a really interesting story. I will be watching it again. I got it on my Kindle with my Prime membership and I will be watching this again!

I loved everything about this movie--unpredictable plot, imperfect characters, satisfying ending, and some light moments to lift the mood.  I do NOT recommend for under 17, and certainly not under 13, due to the graphic, sexual violence that is shown in flashbacks of the crimes he is dealing with.  I didn't let my kids watch it, and you shouldn't let yours, unless they're already hopelessly jaded from watching the evening news.  Other than that, this is just good, solid entertainment for a mature audience.

As an attorney who works out of his Lincoln, McConaughey brings a touch of comic relief to an otherwise serious profession. His character is not afraid to tread where others fear to go, defending people who would probably be shunned by other, more "affluent" lawyers. He finds his way into and out of troubles, keeping your attention all the while.
A fun watch for a movie not intended to be a comedy!
When a manipulating lawyer gets hired by a manipulating client what can happen?  Watch the Lincoln Lawyer and you'll find out.
Great movie it had a lot of action and suspense will be purchasing for my collection. All the actors where great noone disappointed you
I really enjoyed this movie.  Matthew McConaughey's transformation from a hustling attorney on the streets to one who actually cared may be far from reality but purely entertaining.
I read the book and enjoyed how well the movie followed the book. The plot has twists and turns as most Grisham novels do. Great evening entertainment.
I liked the book and the movie. I am a Matthew McConaughey fan and he did not disappoint. I liked the story
It was awesome and I enjoyed it alot, too bad Hollywood doesn't make more movies like this.  It was suspensful, but a bit predictable.
I had seen this movie before but Love Matthew Mcconaughey. He is, like the movie Awesome!  Well written thriller with great character development.

Keeps you guessing. Keeps your attention. Shows what this society is all about(Money)and how money can take care of a lot of things. Let's you know that sometimes it's not worth the money.
D.Woods

Great plot and acting -a worthwhile and thought provoking movie. Great plot and acting -a worthwhile and thought provoking movie.  Do I have to say it twice to be recorded as a review?  Most folks will thoroughly enjoy this movie.  Well done!
I would def recommend this movie, one of those that I could watch several times. You gotta love Matthew McConaughey!
I enjoyed the movie.  It kept me entertainment on my 3-hour shuttle ride to the airport.  I would recommend it.
Poor Matt has a hard time over coming his best and most natural perfomance in Dazed and Confused. This was entertaining.
I enjoyed the movie but was unable to get Closed Caption on our Sony player so missed a lot of the dialogue since I have a severe hearing loss.
it always had me guessing what was going to happen next and was surprised with the ending results, that's all.
Loved this movie. Totally unexpected as I saw the title and expected it to be about Presidenr Lincoln.  Must watch great story.
Matthew McConaughey did an incredible job in his role as the lawyer... great story and makes you want to fix the system  - he didn't fix the system but he did the right thing!
I read the book and it was pretty gripping.  This stayed pretty close to the book, and is well worth watching
Fantastic!  Good paced, entertaining.  This is a movie you can watch more than once.  Soundtrack is pretty good too!  Awesome!
I started the movie and quickly found that a movie concerning a slick lawyer was not my cup of tea so I bailed.
Not a big fan of the man, but pleasantly surprised at the acting. The story line is interesting and engaging. I enjoyed the pace and the intrigue in the story.
Great story and  plot.  Held my interest with its unique twists!  Thought it was over at one point, but it wasn't!
This is a good movie. It won't keep you on the edge of your seat, but it won't put you to sleep either. Anything with Mathew in it is ok by me.
While at times this movie is predictable, it still delivers with a good plot and great performance by McConaughey! If you like suspense movies this is a good one.

In my opinion' it is a good story with complex plot' keeps you engaged and at the edge of you seat waiting for the events to unfold and pleasantly surprised at the same time. Very well played; acting is believable and enjoyable. I would love to watch it again even I already watched it twice

Terrific Movie.  Matthew McConaughey was excellent!!!!!!!!  So glad I bought the movie.  I love it!!!!  I love it!!
Love it!

This film was much more entertaining that I thought.  The story took twists and turns that kept the story interesting.  McConaughey's was quite interesting as the wheeling, dealing attorney who gets some business that gets him in trouble.  Good show.
Was a good movie that was not the normal predictable everyday movie.  Matthew was a nice looking lawyer that did not sit back and let everyone else do all the work.
The plot was unique, but it was an interesting movie.  McConaughey did a good job with his role and plays the part well.  Overall a very good movie.

This is an excellent lawyer movie.  Of course, it's more than slightly unrelealistic to believe that a lawyer can spend the entire portion of the day that he is not in the courtroom, seemingly every day, driving around in a chauffeured limo.  There are such things as legal research, legal writing, computers, computer printers, copiers, legal files storage and access, document preparation, etc. that require a physical office for a lawyer.

Usually I can spot the criminal in short order in movies, but this one had me twisting and turning.  It was a great movie.  It does have strong language and content so it isn't recommended for children, of course.  It kept my interest throughout.  It is not a movie you want to walk away from to get snacks or take a potty break without pressing pause or you will be lost.  It needs your full attention, but has no problem getting it.

The movie was made for your typical television movie. My adult daughters loved it, but I must say it  did seem to go on and on. The story reminded me of one that Matthew M. did years ago, I believe was called Mississippi Burning that was much better..So for what it's worth I am sure you will still find it entertaining :)
Great acting.  Great Plot.  Intelligent writing.  I really liked it.  I've seen it before and still didn't mind watching it again.
Except for a few portions of the film where the dialogue was difficult to hear because of background noise (very common these days), the film was exceptional.

Matthew is a good actor, but I've read Connelly and had pictured a somewhat different character than M.Mc. portrayed.
Unfortunately, I believe I have read this book and maybe somewhat of a spoiler for the movie.  Ho-hum.
Still, there are a lot of worse movies out there.
Was hoping for something other than a Grisham type knock off. Predictable and poor acting by the lead actor McConaughy.
Almost 5 stars ... would have been five stars except I found the plot to be a bit predictable.  Enjoyed the movie a lot, however.
Very intriguing storyline, great acting, well directed.  Highly recommend it!  Matthew McConaughey demonstrates his versatility and talent, and Marissa Tomei was great as supporting actress.
This is Awesome thriller which keeps you thinking all the time through out the movie. I highly recommend the movie to anyone.
I enjoyed watching the movie and yes I would recommend this to my friends and family. I mostly enjoyed watching it on my Kindle Fire Hd
this lawyer was crazy just like his clients. but i did like the part when he had the bikers beat down the rich kid

love this movie love great cast love matthew and ryan also marisa show how we all need help how far will you go for your love ones when he first start out love money more than anything till it comes to his family .

I will admit that I did not expect this movie to be as good as it was. Matthew McConaughey played an impressive, slick, street smart attorney who truly believed that everyone deserved legal representation. To him, the scariest thing to have was an innocent client because if the client went to jail he could not deal with the guilt. He preferred the guilty client because he could then justify his tactics and definitely not feel guilty if the client got time.

The Lincoln Lawyer was a nice little escape. I would not pay to see it in the movies, but I would pay to rent (thank goodness it's included with prime).
It's an average film with average acting but a somewhat interesting plot reversal. Relationships between lawyer and former wife are strange both professionally and personally.
I enjoyed this movie very much. Suspense, romance and Matthew. Every thing you need in a movie. I've seen this movies a few times.

This movie reminds me why I've worked in the law biz for over 30 years - the puzzles, the people, and the predicaments.  And the absolute fun of having "a plan come together" with all those moving pieces.
Good movie! Actors all good and good twist. Matthew McConaughey does his usual good job of acting, I like his movies!
I thought that Matthew McConaughey did a superb acting job in this movie. The plot kept my interest. This movie was entertaining.
I really like this movie. Matthew was awesome and hot as usual. I truly just want to rate some of these movies geez.
This was a very engaging movie, with some unexpected plot twists and turns.  I would recommend this for Matthew McConaughey fans especially.
This was a great movie to watch.  However it is not for young children.  It had a way of showing how Lawyers can work.
Excellent film with very good acting from a solid cast.  Drama and intrigue with an interesting ending. Well worth seeing more than once.
This was an enjoyable better than average movie.  I would like to give it 3 1/2.  Would recommend to friends.

The Michael Connelly book of the same name is much better.  If you are looking for good reads in the crime story genre you can't go wrong with any of Micheal Connelly's novels.  Recommend starting with his first Harry Bosch book, The Black Echo, as his characters entertwine.
I really like Matthew McConaughey he is a good actor and I like most of his movies so when I see he is staring on a movie I know it must be good this is a good show to watch Highly recomend this show

I've heard about this movie, but never understood much about the plot.  It definitely held my interest throughout, and I'm glad I took the time to watch it.  There were a few good plot twists as well.  Enjoyed the movie and wouldn't mind watching it again.
I love movies that keep me on my toes, and The Lincoln Lawyer does just that! It has a few nice little twists that you never see coming and the actors are great! Highly recommend!
Man this movie is good, very good. Liked the suspense in this and the twist at the end is superb.
This was a great movie!  I would highly recommend watching this movie, it was well worth it.  Also love MM
Great movie. Entertaining, captivating plot, humor when you need it. Gives good insight into the minds of lawyers. Definite recommendation!
Funny, sort of suspenseful, kept me guessing until the end. McConaughey was awesome in this film. He played the character well and had great delivery. Enjoyable and entertaining film.
Very good movie...long but worth it.  All of the actors did a great job.  Nice ending.  I really enjoyed it.

After reading the book and reading some of the other Amazon reviews I decided to watch this movie.  I was very disappointed in the result.  The movie plot did not provide for charter development and was more of a cartoon or TV show version of the book.  The plot it self was a shallow as the characters.  All in all a waste of my time.  There are better dramas on FX to be watched then to spend time on this movie.
The acting was mediocre in this film but the story was engaging.  Matthew McConaughey can and has done better work.  It entertained.
I normally don't like M.M. Movies but this wasn't too bad. Good twist at end kept us wondering. Glad I didn't pay to rent on PPV, but glad I watched.

The premise is interesting...A lawyer who uses his car as his office...The interwoven plot works well, interesting characters come and go...McConaughey is well cast in the lead roll...The movie moves along with few 'dead' spots...Worth a look.

Certainly exceeded our expectations. McConaughey is at his best in this type of role, so it seems, although he seldom disappoints.  The final resolution is lacking any complexity, but that didn't diminish the overall experience.
A great job of portraying the character from the book.  Nicely done. I think they captured the style of what a slick attorney Haller is, yet how he fights for justice within the system.

When I heard about this movie, I wasn't sure what to expect. What I got was something predictable--and yet not quite. Matthew Mac Connohey is the lawyer, who has an office in his Lincoln Continental. His dealings are somewhat shady, but he does stay within the limits of the law. Most of his clientele are rough,but he knows his way around them. He has a good reputation for getting people off and his next case is a strange one. The man is seeking to go free, problem is, he is really guilty, but because of client lawyer confidentiality he cannot do much against it. There is a plot twist here, and not without some dark humor. You'll have to watch and see.

Good cast, well paced. Excellent plot.
Held my interest through the entire film.
Mathew D. (the star) handles this kind of role very well.
I was skeptical at first that this was just another twist on "The Client", but it was rather good and the plot kept you guessing right up to the end. Tomei is always good! Really liked it.
a very good movie with Matthew McConaughey and Marisa Tomei very good suspense type movie. I would highly recommend it.
The story takes some unexpected twists and turns and never dulls.  It is not drawn out.  I highly recommend this movie.
Great cast, great shots of LA, I always enjoy Matt's movies, and this one is right up there.  Definitely recommend this one.
Kept me interested, good job taking seemingly unrelated events/people and connecting them.  I will probably watch it again just to see it from a new perspective.
This was the first movie that I watched as an Amazon Prime member.  I enjoyed Matthew McConaughey - as usual - and though the plot was fairly predictable...it was a movie I would see again.
The movie was enjoyable and had a great pace.  The characters seemed well developed and the twists were hidden well.  The movie was worth my time to watch.
Matthew McConaughey is a super cool lawyer with street smarts.  Lots of fun watching this movie.  I'd even watch it again, and that's saying a lot!

This was an excellent book AND a Wonderful movie from Amazon.  It is not expensive to rent a movie from Amazon and watch it on your TV.  i would like for all of you to give yourselves the opportunity to read the book or listen to the audio book and also, watch the movie afterwards. All 3 opportunities will be a gift for you and your family.

Sincerely,
Linda T
Great movie even for multiple viewing. A great addition to movie collections. Watched the free VOD that came with movie easily on my iPad
dont waste your time...matthew mc conaughey just over acts so much it takes away from the rest of the movie,,,,very boring I couldn't even finish watching.
I really like Matthew McConaughey. His parts aren't all that different, but he brings a great style to the roles he plays. The supporting cast is also good in this movie.
Well written movie that keeps u locked in!!!  It helps us understand the need for lawyers to represent criminals fairly.

Terrific job of acting on the part of McConaughey and Tomei. An edge of your seat thriller to the very end.
Well shot and edited. This one is a keeper
I thought the movie was well done and probably closer to a real life situation than we'd like to think.

There are a small handful of movies I don't mind watching multiple times, whereas most movies are good for only one viewing.  This is a movie I know I will be watching again.  I already have a daddy/daughter date set up for my second viewing.  When my wife finishes school and finally has more time on her hands, I know I'll have another viewing.  I have the book ordered too, and I'm looking forward to its arrival and reading.  Usually the books are better than the movies, but this is an excellent movie.  You will be entertained, thrilled, surprised, and satisfied when the end finally rolls around.  If you like John Grisham's lawyer movies, you should enjoy this one.
I really liked the book and didn't expect the movie to be as good but it was.  Moves along with plenty of action and plot twists.

I'm not overly fond of McConaughey as an actor, but I thought this movie seemed interesting enough to give it a chance. Overall I was happily surprised by it, the story of a high priced attorney who seems to not have any moral fiber, but finds his limits in his most recent case defending a man accused of assault. The dynamic with Marisa Tomei plays well into the story line, if a little over the top in their relationship. It is a solid drama, maybe not edge of your seat worthy, but above average overall and worth your two hours I would say.

This movie has an unexpected twist in the plot when MM represents a man who strongly claims he is innocent. I watched it on my computer using Amazon Prime free online videos.  If I paid to see it in the movie theatre, I would have probably given the movie 4 stars because it is hard to beat laying in my bad wrapped in a blanket with my pillow watching a movie in my most comfortable position.  Nevertheless, I think the actors and actresses (such as Marisa Tomei) did well in the movie and it had a very intriguing plot.  I am glad that they had a very beautiful age appropriate woman in the movie and didn't search for a female star in the nurseries of hollywood.  I had to stop it halfway through and I couldn't wait to come back and finish the movie the next night.
Fast paced, exciting, loved the ending. Just plain excellent.  Recommend to any audience who likes lawyer drams with a twist.
Great older movie, kept you wanting to watch it all the way through .. Really enjoyed would recommend to anyone
I like Matthew McConaughey in most everything.  This movie was fast paced and had a lot of twists to make it interesting.  The outcome was predictable, however.
Mathew has a thick accent and subtitles are needed to catch every detail of the movie drama. Amazon should include subtitles in its options.
I enjoyed the movie but the book was much better. I visualized the characters much differently than the cast in this movie. Matthew McConaughey would not be my choice as lead character.
Great twists and turns, on the edge of your seat courtroom drama. Matthew McConaughey is terrific in this film! Spellbinding cast!
I loved this movie, I watched this while video streaming on amazon.  This was great.  Love Matthew McConaughey in this movie.

This is a very entertaining movie. It is a different twist on the lawyer/courtroom genre. McConaughey plays a lawyer who serves the underbelly of society from the backseat of his Licoln Towncar. in the process, he discovers something about himself and the law that he had lost.
Good Acting, clever dialog. (That's really all I wanted to say but I am required to type sixteen more words)

Pretty good  movie if you aren't looking for a deep-thinking exercise. I like McConaughey, and he brings a fairly predicable, standard performance in this one. If you are looking to relax and kill a couple of hours, this is a good choice.
Good movie. Interesting premise. A bit hard to believe though, but still enjoyable. Marisa Tomei is always great! Ryan Phillipe plays a great bad guy.
I had never seen this before, but I had wanted to.  Prime gave me the chance to see this movie without having to pay extra for it.  I would watch it again.
Great product, no problems, quick to ship, Item exactly as explained in the description. well worth the money, great price.
Enjoyable movie. Mathew McConaughey was charming and young in this show. I liked the storyline and  got into hoping he was sucessful.
Great movie!  Matthew McConaughey is awesome.  (as usual)  Ryan Phillipe is also great in his usual pretty-boy psycho roll.  Go ahead and watch it.  You won't regret it...

We enjoyed the movie thoroughly.  The characters are engaging and the story keeps you engaged all the way through.  I thought the portrayal of the relationship between main character, a defense attorney,  and his ex wife, a public prosecutor, was well done.
The movie was very well done.  It was slick and transitioned well.  The lead actor was very charismatic and played the character masterfully.
Good twists-keeps you watching.  Matthew McConaughey was very good, as we all others.  Very watchable in a wasteland of movies to choose from, this one's worth giving a try.
Easy to watch, not too complicated.  Selected it to watch while catching up on my ironing.  Would recommend it to others.

Parts of the plot can flash by pretty quickly and can be a bit intricate, but I love it all, and it all makes sense. It's the attitude of the film that that sets it apart from similar plot lines/films. You kinda wish you were there, instead of sitting back with the audience.
Good movie; kept my attention; very good cast with good acting.  Can't say this about many movies I've chosen lately.
This is a story about a defense lawyer who actually does good. Mathew McConaughey is excellent in this role and makes the movie a treat to watch.
Can't believe I missed this in the theaters when it first came out... but THRILLED I could rent through amazon.com.

I like that the movie held my attention, and it revealed how the truth will always set you free.  Matthew McConaughey and Marisa Tomei are among my favorite actors and I loved both of their performances in The Lincoln Lawyer.
Matthew McConaughey was incredible. Nice plot that turns the tables around. Definitely worth watching this movie, I enjoyed it greatly.

I suppose if you were a fan of Matthew McConaughey you might like this flick, but I got tired of him mugging his good looks for the camera during a blase plot involving improbable characters.  I couldn't wait for the end, and shut it off just past the halfway mark, and haven't felt compelled to see the conclusion.  Pure tripe.
I waited a long time to see this movie. Then it was finally released on Prime. I enjoyed watching it. It contained a good plot with great acting.
Excellent movie.  Fast paced, great actors and plot.  Would recommend to family and friends.  Easy to stream with Amazon Prime.

I randomly picked this movie to watch the other day with little expectations. Turned out to be an amazing movie. I wonder if what that guy made is legal, but it was genius. I'm quite sure this was based in a true story. A warning: keep your full attention all the time, otherwise you'll be lost at some point. I really think the main character deserves other movies, but not "The Lincoln Lawyer - Part II" please. Congratulations to the elaborate editing work and, of course, to the whole cast.
Real High Definition (1920x1080) for Vizio TV and PC will be the best of the best!!! Just to enjoy the movie and the device.
Ok. Somewhat entertaining. Story line predictable. What was entertaning was the twist and turns but not much more than that.
I hadn't heard much buzz about this movie, but gave it a shot last weekend and was greatly surprised!  Solid movie.  I suggest giving it a go, as well!

As a home rental it gets four stars.  The story line is not at all a new concept and the first half of the movie drags just a bit.  However, I thought it was well acted and it managed to be entertaining even though it was never surprising.
Very interesting turn of events. Some action with characters that you've developed relations with. Twist after twist with a legal side.

Engaging, entertaining, intelligent and leaves you satisfied with a good ending. Better than the mindless violence that seems to be status quo nowadays. Well worth the $1.99 rental fee, no regrets and we felt we "picked a good one"!
In the end, you know the good guy wins but the story line is strong and enjoyable. I would recommend this one.
I really enjoyed this movie, it had suspense and had me on the edge of my seat.  Matthew M was an A+
I do not like to listen to profanity.  I do not use it and I do feel I should have to listen to it.

Its a good movie, the story line is the as several movies from the past, the ending

my first movie I watched on Amazon,
A QUICK LAWYER WITH SOME FUNNY WAYS OF DOIN BUSINESS.THIS IS A FAST MOVING STORY WITH A FEW TWISTS AND TURNS AT THE END. FUN MOVIE
If you like McConaghey, he's done it again.  Lots of intrigue and keeps your interest to see if the bad guy gets what he deserves.
...but with the twist at the end, it felt a bit like it was thrown in, as if the backstory could have been developed a bit more. Still, it was solid.
Matthew can teach me life lessons any day! Good plot, well developed. Very real life and holds interest. Thanks not one of his best performances but good movie

Handsome, suave, oh and a good actor!! The story line was great! I really liked the twists and turns!! I never would have thought that the one who killed his friend/investigator was that person!!! Awesome. Thanks for providing this kind of quality movie.
A great story of ups and downs with a happy ending. Lots of action and one of uncle ron's favorite movies. I highly recomend this movie.
This was a great show for people who want to be a cop or a lawyer. It was a great Tv show I would give it 5 stars

Seriously flawed movie with mediocre plot, no character development, really bad performances (you almost think that the actors are going to burst out laughing while doing a serious scene), stereotyping, unnecessary characters (William H Macy, Kate Mulligan, John Leguizamo, Marisa Tomei, Frances Fisher, et al)  Jeez people! Is this what we've come down to? Avoid it.
I gave it a 5 star rating because of the great acting and storyline. I  especially liked the idea of the defense attorney seeking justice, rather than getting a victory at all costs.
Matthew McConaughey is great in anything, but this had some twists and turns in it, and kept you guessing until the end..
A lawyer first recommended this book cause it really does portray what it is like for a criminal defense lawyer much of the time.  And it is well written, not easy to find.

I read the book first and felt it was one of the best plots I have read lately.  The movie hits only the highlights of the very involved book, but never the less, is a really good movie as is anything with Matthew McConaughey.
Steller performance by Matthew McConaughey.  The Lincoln office was genius and I also liked the play on words of the title.
The acting is brilliant.  The plot twists are scintillating.  It's suspenseful and riveting. And, the suspense is interwoven with comedic action that will tickle the funny-bone.
Though I feel it would have been better served as a TV Movie it was good entertainment and wothe watching.
Love Michael Connelly's books but the movie was a far cry in comparison,McConnagy was good, but overall very average, The End
Great movie. The title threw me off a bit: it's about a lawyer who pretty much operates out of his car. Good twisty plot.
great, well written and plot was demonstrated very well actors were well prepared and showed there input well; by the attention they gave.the story.
A decent movie to watch. Interesting story line...some things were very predictable. Pleasant way to spend some time. Watched on my IPad
Excellent acting and very good plot. Well worth watching. This movie reminded me of a John Grisham story but acting was better then most Grisham movies.
I watched this late at night ... something to go to sleep by.  Nope ... watched the whole thing and was entertained.  A pleasant surprise.

What happens when a clever lawyer who does not hesitate to get his hands dirty in the commerce of the judicial system encounters a situation when he must right a wrong once committed? The Lincoln Lawyer offers the expected plot twists and building tension but in how a seemingly amoral lawyer changes when he finds he must redeem himself.
This is a very well done movie.  Great acting by the star and his driver especially.  Can't think of anything that I would change.  It's good enough that I will watch it a second time.
Excellent movie - read the book also and really like this author. Recommend to anybody who is interested in legal plots.
Great movie with great acting. Can't say much more with out giving away plot. My 14 yearold daughter and I both watch the movie.
This movie is worth watching. Twists and turns in the plot keep you guessing. I would highly recommend this movie.

had plot excitement plenty of entertainment  and they got the bad guys in the end kept you guessing till the end

Mr. McConaughey really is at his best in this legal thriller with lots of twists and very believable plot and performances of all throughout. This movie should have been much more successful in the theaters if current audiences had any taste which I fear is lacking.

If it had done better at the box office, this could have been the first of many McConaughey-as-Mickey Haller movies, but it looks like we'll have to settle for this one. And it is exceptional. Why it wasn't a hit I don't know. Perhaps it asked too much of the viewer, demanding too many inferences to carry the story. But if you have read the book first, as I did, the movie is a spot-on and easy to follow rendition of a terrific crime novel.
His quick wit and passion at his best. Get lost in lincoln lawyer. I would let him be my lawyer anytime.

Don't miss a minute or you'll miss the whole movie. Mathew reminds me of a classic Sherlock Holmes. He is always ahead of the game and keeps you on the edge of your seat. A real surprise ending!

Matthew McConaughey plays a lawyer who goes to the client,scene, in his Lincoln car with chauffeur. He doesn't have an office and works out of the Lincoln. someting easy for a rainy afternoon or a lazy weekend. i would watch it again and again thank you ok

Its was worth watching. Interesting plot contortions manage to successfully walk the line between believable and contrived for the most part. Its attempt to elevate the ambulance chaser to slime ball +1 status almost succeeds.
a gift that my husband loved. He wouldn't go to movies to see it so I bought DVD and we both loved it.
Good flick, easy to keep up with, must see for mathew fans. Although not a lot of ah-ha moments. But still a decent movie.

I could not watch this movie and will not be able to watch future movies because it stops every few minutes.  I disabled my screen saver but it  continued to do this.  I saw the movie before and was looking forward to watching it again.

This is quietly entertaining mind popcorn.  The nicest thing about it is that it shows that McConaughey is willing to take some risks with his image and career.  Instead of close-ups of his 6-pack abs, there are close-ups of every line and wrinkle on his face. Wow. In the wrong light, even the beautiful look lousy.

Mathew McConaughey was super, showing his ego faults and  his quick conclusions with the evidence. Not very realistic but entertaining.

Very entertaining, liked it very much.
a lot of action, but nothing to write home about, something to pass some time on a rainy day at home.

wonderful movie with Matthew McConaughey!
if you like him in his other movies you will love this one, much better than The Paperboy, that was lousy!

However the ending just seemed weak.  For the middle portions, it gets very smart; but it fails to conclude with the same brains and finesse. With such a great cast, you have to blame sub-par directing.
This tells the real story of a lawyer and what he has to go through to practice law as well as help the good man and put the bad man in prison.  It has a lots of action.
Great acting and story line.  I thought it dragged slightly at the beginning, but a foundation had to be built I guess.

A well written and played movie with an entertaining central theme.
Action packed and full of suspense.
The actor is engaging and holds interest through out the movie.
Well-acted and written. Didn't think I was a Matthew McConnaughey fan until now! Gripping story, well told, a tribute to Michael Connelly, the author.

I'm always glad to see a movie where I can't guess the next thing that is going to happen. This movie was entertaining. awesome awesome movie Marisa Tomei  and all the actors are awesome wish they did part two and the price is awesome

Macey, Marisa Tomei, Brian Cranston -- could not carry the weak and predictable dialogue.  Characters are shallow and two-dimensional.  Disclaimer: In all fairness, I stopped watching about 30 minutes before the end during the big courtroom scene.  I just wasn't confident that the conclusion of the movie would make up for the disappointing stoyline and dialogue up to that point.

Psycho-thriller deluxe!
"nothing is as it appears"
I watched this years back. I re-watched it Mar 1, 2013. Still caught me off-guard. Well done suspense.

I found is enjoyable and with enough twists to make it flow to the end. Matthew is convincing in the part.

Xlnt! It had all the elements of a good movie. Keeps us watching to see what happens. Good wins in the end.

Matthew Mc does one of his usual parts great parts as someone that doesn't follow a straight line. Here you have a lawyer with no office that does well cause his expenses. He goes to visit his clients. I guess that's a great idea having no office no staff only expenses the car and driver. The way this main part was written could only be played by a good actor and in this case  Matthew makes it work. Good movie!
McConaughey gives a great performance! The plot of the story keeps viewers wondering of what is happening next, also who can resist McConaughey's charm and good looks!

I love Matthew in this flick. Actually, I enjoy most of his flicks. He's got that extra something special that only a few actors have. He has the aire about him that he could actually pull off being a stree-savvy lawyer.

Plain awesome movie!
great plot & interesting predicament, and ingeneous solution to moral dilemma. A few interesting characters. Would like to see more movies featuring the main character.

Worth watching.

too much ganster stuff. Felt like I was at work and after viewing it, I felt like I was living in the inner city.

This is a good movie!  Can't believe I missed it at the movies.  Matt D. always puts out a good performance.  It is a perfect example of how the rich think they can get away with anything.  And how the psychotic mind works.  They only way to beat crazy is with crazy.
It was a great movie. Really keeps you on your toes. Would def recommend to anyone looking for a movie to watch
Much more interesting than I originally expected.  Under advertised, my husband really enjoyed it.  Suspense, era a, little action, and some comedy.

Worth watching.  Entertaining and well acted.  Not a happy flick by any means, but I don't mind that in the least.
It held my attention the entire time and made me think.  I liked seeing how M.M.'s character worked out his "end game".
Kept me on the edge of my seat....then the AHA moment was great. Even after reading the book, I enjoyed the movie.
The product was exactly what I expected, so I am not too disappointed. If you want to buy something average, and expect that then this product is for you.

I am new to Amazon Prime. I chose The Lincoln Lawyer as my first movie to view. Unfortunately closed caption was not available for this video via Amazon and I had to find the movie elswhere so my husband could enjoy it also.
I enjoyed watching the Lincoln Lawyer.  The plot was well conceived and the acting was spot on.  Give it a try.
I love this movie.  When I cannot think of anything to watch I normally watch this.  Great story and surprising.

One is given the impression that he knows what he is doing in the beginning of the movie, but after time goes along we find he is a thief and manipulator. Perry Mason he was not. Perry probably would have gotten 4 stars, only because he failed only in two cases in his whole carrier.

A fear came over me in watching the movie, which was "wondering if LA lawyers were really that bad? If so it provide with one reason why so many are in prison today.

On the good side: This was more entertaining than watching "Howard the Duck."

I'm not sure of the actor's name who portrayed the man wrongfully prosecuted, convicted and ultimately put on death row for a crime committed by someone rich and powerful, but his performance was simply outstanding. From a desperate, poor man going through the legal system who can only think about what his conviction would do to his mom to a numb, cynical man was nothing short of brilliant. Matthew McConaughey also gives a wonderful performance, adding a depth to his character that some of his other roles have not demanded. Marissa Tormei was wonderful, as always, and a great supporting cast make this movie well worth watching. Maybe even more than once!
This movie keeps you guessing until the end.  The story is suspenseful, well developed, and brilliantly executed by an impressive cast.

The title of this short review was seen by yours truly in the restroom of a legal library long ago, and it is also colorfully characterized by "The Lincoln Lawyer".
I really enjoyed this movie.
Enjoyed seeing Matthew in a different type of role. Good story line. Could not get to a stopping point to take a break.

Just about everything Michael Connelly put in the novel is on the screen for better or worse. This is a story with a twist. In my opinion, the twist works better in the book than in the movie. In the latter, I feel credulity was strained. For all that, I liked the movie better than Amazon's " it's okay" which is their 3-star rating. So I gave it four. In a conventional rating system I would rate this a 3 out of 5 stars.

I chose the movie first of all because I like Matthew McConaughey, he is an excellent actor and gives a good twist to any movies he is in.  The Title intrigued me:  "Lincoln Lawyer" what a great title!!  And who would of thought an attorney would have
his office in the back of a Lincoln!  Brilliant!

  Well written story that moves fast and keeps your interest as you wonder what's going to happen next.  A must see!

Its a lawyer movie with alot of cool stuff thrown in the mix... And drives around in a lincoln

Good rental.
Movie had a good plot with many twists and turns, humor and sadness; kept my interest all the way through. Solid acting from all the cast.
It was an enjoyable movie.  I would recommend it to others to watch.  The actors all worked well together.  That is it.
Unlike most novel to film ventures, The Lincoln Lawyer captures all the suspense and surprises of the original. Very well done and very well cast. Matthew McConaughey is spot on as Mickey Haller.
Mathew McConaughey nailed it. Didn't see that ending coming. More like non-fiction...with a storyline like that.  Great friday night movie.

Okay film.. nothing great about story line.. could have been better but the story lacked depth.... can be seen once

I really enjoyed this. When I loaded it into my Kindle I forgot I had seen it in the theater in the past; but that was okay.
I liked the reality of the solo practitioner living by his wits, of the DA ex-wife. The missing witness "Mr. Green" is a reality in that life.
The need to reconcile his obligation to his client with the moral obligation to do right by his locked up former client was a major tension and arc of the story.
this is Matthew McConaughey at his best.  I like that the movie is filled with suspense.  Matthew basically got his client off and convicted him at the same time, but he deserved it.
I appreciate the fact that Icould watch a high energy movie and not be bombarded with course language and nudity.
My boyfriend and I enjoyed this movie. Sometimes its difficult to find something we both enjoy watching, so that was a big plus for me.
We enjoyed this movie.  It kept you guessing.  Matthew McConaughey was good. It kept our interest all the way to the end.

I don't know how I ordered this movie! I have the Prime membership and must have thought it was a free one! I did not watch it, but I was billed $14.99 to my credit card. I should be able to return it with no charge.  Not happy!  :(
Hadn't heard of this before and was pleasantly surprised, although I like all the actors in this.  So wasn't suprised that I enjoyed it.
I thought this had to do with the president but found out it was his car loved it! He does his lawyering out of his Lincoln town car I enjoyed it!

I couldn't figure out how he was going to get out of the predicament he was in and liked the outcome and the way it was done. Kind of a suspense, mystery.  I enjoyed the move a great deal!

somewhat predictable but entertaining nonetheless.  i got it for free on prime, but i would say it's also worth renting.
I was surprised at how good this one was. I think it lived up to the hype a rare thing imho.

The Lincoln Lawyer is based on the best selling novel by Michael Connelly and he isn't the typical lawyer you've seen portrayed in every John Grisham/Law & Order wannabe. Matthew McConaughey is great as Mick Haller. This guy is unbelievably smart, charming, and refreshing. McConaughey takes the brains from a Time To Kill, throws in the swagger of Sahara, and adds in the stellar writing of Connelly, (who mixes old school wit and modern ideals), to create a character that is easily the best of his career. It honestly seems to me like the role was written for McConaughey, it is that good of a match. Ryan Phillippe plays Haller's client in the film and continues to blossom from the shy southern boy in White Squall to a guy who will one day be a major player in Hollywood. It's hard to review a film like this without spoilers, all I can tell you is this. The Lincoln Lawyer is one of the smartest movies I've seen in a long time. The writing is phenomenal, the acting is top notch, and in a slow year for movies, this is a hidden gem!
